text: Generally applicable principles and provisions: The principles and provisions referred to in Chapters-2, 3, 4 and 5 of Part 1 of this Act shall generally apply to the offences under this Act and other Acts.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 4 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-1 (Preliminary) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Generally applicable principles and provisions: The principles and provisions referred to in Chapters-2, 3, 4 and 5 of Part 1 of this Act shall generally apply to the offences under this Act and other Acts.

text: Application of special Act: Where a special Act defines a specific act as a separate offence and provides punishment for it, that Act shall apply to such offence. 6
chunk_text: Clause ID: 5 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-1 (Preliminary) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Application of special Act: Where a special Act defines a specific act as a separate offence and provides punishment for it, that Act shall apply to such offence. 6

text: Lawful act not to be offence: No act required by law to be done or excused by law shall be considered to be an offence.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 6 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Lawful act not to be offence: No act required by law to be done or excused by law shall be considered to be an offence.

text: Not punishment except in accordance with law: No person shall be liable to punishment for doing an act not punished by law nor shall a person be subjected to punishment which is heavier than the one prescribed by law in force when the offence was committed.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 7 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Not punishment except in accordance with law: No person shall be liable to punishment for doing an act not punished by law nor shall a person be subjected to punishment which is heavier than the one prescribed by law in force when the offence was committed.

text: Act done by mistake of fact not to be offence: No act done by a person who is, or who by reason of a mistake of fact, in good faith believes that he or she is bound by law to do that act or that such act is excused by law shall be considered to be an offence. Provided that no act done in ignorance of law shall be excused.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 8 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Act done by mistake of fact not to be offence: No act done by a person who is, or who by reason of a mistake of fact, in good faith believes that he or she is bound by law to do that act or that such act is excused by law shall be considered to be an offence. Provided that no act done in ignorance of law shall be excused.

text: No punishment again for the same offense: No person shall be prosecuted in a court and punished again for the same offence.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 9 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: No punishment again for the same offense: No person shall be prosecuted in a court and punished again for the same offence.

text: No deprivation of fair trial: No person shall be deprived of fair trial in proceedings by a competent court or judicial authority.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 10 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: No deprivation of fair trial: No person shall be deprived of fair trial in proceedings by a competent court or judicial authority.

text: No compulsion to testify against oneself: No person accused of an offence shall be compelled to testify against himself or herself.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 11 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: No compulsion to testify against oneself: No person accused of an offence shall be compelled to testify against himself or herself.

text: Presumption of innocence until proven guilty: A person accused of an offence shall be presumed innocent until proved guilty of that offence.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 12 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Presumption of innocence until proven guilty: A person accused of an offence shall be presumed innocent until proved guilty of that offence.

text: Act of a child not to be offence: No act done by a child below ten years of age shall be considered to be an offence. 7
chunk_text: Clause ID: 13 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Act of a child not to be offence: No act done by a child below ten years of age shall be considered to be an offence. 7

text: Act of a person of unsound mind not to be offence: No act done by a person who, at the time of doing it, by reason of unsoundness of mind, is incapable of knowing the nature, characteristic, fault or consequence of such act, shall be considered to be an offence.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 14 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Act of a person of unsound mind not to be offence: No act done by a person who, at the time of doing it, by reason of unsoundness of mind, is incapable of knowing the nature, characteristic, fault or consequence of such act, shall be considered to be an offence.

text: Act done by consent not to be offence: Except where done with the intention of causing death or grievous hurt or with the knowledge that it is likely to cause death or grievous hurt, no act done by a person by obtaining consent of a person above eighteen years of age which causes any harm to the person who has given such consent shall be considered to be an offence.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 15 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Act done by consent not to be offence: Except where done with the intention of causing death or grievous hurt or with the knowledge that it is likely to cause death or grievous hurt, no act done by a person by obtaining consent of a person above eighteen years of age which causes any harm to the person who has given such consent shall be considered to be an offence.

text: Act done for benefit by consent not to be offence: No act done by a person in good faith and with due care for the benefit of another person by consent of that other person which causes harm to that person who has given such consent shall be considered to be an offence.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 16 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Act done for benefit by consent not to be offence: No act done by a person in good faith and with due care for the benefit of another person by consent of that other person which causes harm to that person who has given such consent shall be considered to be an offence.

text: Act done for benefit by consent of guardian not to be offence: No act done in good faith and with due care for the benefit of a person below eighteen years of age, or of unsoundness of mind due to mental illness, by his or her guardian or another person by consent of the guardian, which causes harm to that person shall be considered to be an offence. Provided that except where done for the purpose of preventing death or grievous hurt, no person who does an act with the knowledge that it is likely to cause death or grievous hurt shall be dispensed with criminal liability. 8
chunk_text: Clause ID: 17 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Act done for benefit by consent of guardian not to be offence: No act done in good faith and with due care for the benefit of a person below eighteen years of age, or of unsoundness of mind due to mental illness, by his or her guardian or another person by consent of the guardian, which causes harm to that person shall be considered to be an offence. Provided that except where done for the purpose of preventing death or grievous hurt, no person who does an act with the knowledge that it is likely to cause death or grievous hurt shall be dispensed with criminal liability. 8

text: Act done for benefit without consent not to be offence: Where any act must be done immediately for the benefit of a person, and such person is, for any reason, not in a position to give consent immediately or has no guardian from whom it is possible to obtain consent on such person's behalf immediately, such act done in good faith and with due care for the benefit of that person without his or her consent, which causes harm or injury to that person, shall not be considered to be an offence. text: Harm caused by communication made in good faith not to be offence: No information or communication of any matter made in good faith shall be considered to be an offence by reason of any harm to the person to whom it is made, if it is made for the benefit of that person.

text: Act done in good faith to prevent other harm, injury not to be offence: Any act done by a person shall not be considered to be an offence merely by reason of its being done with the knowledge that it is likely to cause harm, injury, if it be done without any criminal intent to cause harm, injury, and in good faith for the purpose of preventing or avoiding possible great harm, injury to life, person or property and it was so imminent that greater harm, injury than such act was likely to result in would be caused to the life, person or property of him or her or any one else if such act was not done immediately.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 23 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Act done in good faith to prevent other harm, injury not to be offence: Any act done by a person shall not be considered to be an offence merely by reason of its being done with the knowledge that it is likely to cause harm, injury, if it be done without any criminal intent to cause harm, injury, and in good faith for the purpose of preventing or avoiding possible great harm, injury to life, person or property and it was so imminent that greater harm, injury than such act was likely to result in would be caused to the life, person or property of him or her or any one else if such act was not done immediately.

text: Any act done in the exercise of the right of private defence subject to this Chapter shall not be considered to be an offence.

text: Every person has a right to defend the body, life or property of his or her own or of any other person against any illegal harm. 11
parent_text: Act done for private defence not considered to be offence
chunk_text: Clause ID: 24(2) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: Act done for private defence not considered to be offence | Text: Every person has a right to defend the body, life or property of his or her own or of any other person against any illegal harm. 11

text: The right of private defence under this Section shall be exercised only when there is a reasonable apprehension or reasonable cause to believe that the body, life or property of his or her own or of any other person cannot be defended against any illegal harm unless any act is done immediately.
parent_text: Act done for private defence not considered to be offence

text: Act causing slight harm not to be offence: A slight harm not to be complained of by a person of ordinary sense shall not be considered to be an offence.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 27 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Act causing slight harm not to be offence: A slight harm not to be complained of by a person of ordinary sense shall not be considered to be an offence.

text: Major liable to punishment for offence caused to be committed by child: Where an offence is committed by a child upon being lured, taught or influenced by a person to do so, such person shall be liable to punishment as if the offence were committed by himself or herself.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 28 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Major liable to punishment for offence caused to be committed by child: Where an offence is committed by a child upon being lured, taught or influenced by a person to do so, such person shall be liable to punishment as if the offence were committed by himself or herself.

text: Criminal intention not to be examined in strict liability offence: In an offence which is a strict liability offence under this Act or the law, there shall not be examined whether or not the offence was committed intentionally.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 29 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Criminal intention not to be examined in strict liability offence: In an offence which is a strict liability offence under this Act or the law, there shall not be examined whether or not the offence was committed intentionally.

text: Criminal liability for offence committed by body corporate to be vested on one who commits or causes the commission of the act: Where any firm, company or body corporate commits, or causes the commission of, an act considered to be an offence under this Act or law, the person who committed, or caused the commission of, such offence shall be responsible for such act; and where such person cannot be identified, the concerned owners and partners who did such act, in the case of a firm, the director, managing director, general manager who did or caused the doing of such act, in the case of a company or body corporate, and where even such person cannot be identified, the chief executive of such body shall bear the criminal liability. 15
chunk_text: Clause ID: 30 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Criminal liability for offence committed by body corporate to be vested on one who commits or causes the commission of the act: Where any firm, company or body corporate commits, or causes the commission of, an act considered to be an offence under this Act or law, the person who committed, or caused the commission of, such offence shall be responsible for such act; and where such person cannot be identified, the concerned owners and partners who did such act, in the case of a firm, the director, managing director, general manager who did or caused the doing of such act, in the case of a company or body corporate, and where even such person cannot be identified, the chief executive of such body shall bear the criminal liability. 15

text: All members to be punished for offence committed by a group: Where an offence is committed by a group of two or more persons, all members of the group shall be liable to punishment for such offence.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 31 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (General Principles of Criminal Justice) | Parent Clause: None | Text: All members to be punished for offence committed by a group: Where an offence is committed by a group of two or more persons, all members of the group shall be liable to punishment for such offence.

text: Victim of crime to be entitled to obtain information of proceedings of case and compensation: (1) The victim of crime shall have the right to obtain information about the investigation and proceedings of the case in which he or she is the victim.

text: A person who, with the intention of committing an offence, aids in the commission of such offence or other offence or who hides the offender or helps the offender to escape after the commission of the offence or who provides means to commit, or causes the commission of, the offense or otherwise assists in the commission of the offence shall be deemed to be an accomplice.

text: For an accomplice other than one referred to in clause (a), punishment not exceeding one half of 19 the punishment imposable for the commission of such offence according to the degree of his or her involvement in that act.

text: Computation of imprisonment for life: Except in the circumstance referred to in Section 41, the sentence of imprisonment for life shall be so computed that its term is twenty-five years.

text: One and half punishment for consolidated/integrated offence
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
chunk_text: Clause ID: 43 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief) | Parent Clause: None | Text: One and half punishment for consolidated/integrated offence

text: Where a person, at the time of judgment by a court, is convicted of more than one offence on a single occasion or different offences on different occasions, such person shall be deemed to have committed a consolidated offence.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
parent_text: One and half punishment for consolidated/integrated offence
chunk_text: Clause ID: 43(1) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief) | Parent Clause: One and half punishment for consolidated/integrated offence | Text: Where a person, at the time of judgment by a court, is convicted of more than one offence on a single occasion or different offences on different occasions, such person shall be deemed to have committed a consolidated offence.

text: The offender who commits a consolidated offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be sentenced for the offence punishable by the maximum punishment and to additional punishment of one half of that punishment specified for such offence.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
parent_text: One and half punishment for consolidated/integrated offence
chunk_text: Clause ID: 43(2) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief) | Parent Clause: One and half punishment for consolidated/integrated offence | Text: The offender who commits a consolidated offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be sentenced for the offence punishable by the maximum punishment and to additional punishment of one half of that punishment specified for such offence.

text: Additional punishment for offender of heinous crime and recidivist: (1) If a person who was sentenced for any offence commits another heinous or grave offence before the expiry of a period of five years after the date on which he or she completed the service of that sentence or was granted pardon, he or she shall be considered to be a recidivist. 26
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
chunk_text: Clause ID: 44 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Additional punishment for offender of heinous crime and recidivist: (1) If a person who was sentenced for any offence commits another heinous or grave offence before the expiry of a period of five years after the date on which he or she completed the service of that sentence or was granted pardon, he or she shall be considered to be a recidivist. 26

text: A recidivist shall be liable to a punishment that is up to double the punishment imposable for the last offence committed by him or her. Provided that this Section shall not apply to an offender who has been sentenced to imprisonment for life pursuant to Section 41.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)

text: Punishment imposable on children
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
chunk_text: Clause ID: 45 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Punishment imposable on children

text: A person who commits an act constituting an offence under the law shall not be liable to any punishment if that person has not attained ten years of age at the time of the commission of such act.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
parent_text: Punishment imposable on children
chunk_text: Clause ID: 45(1) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief) | Parent Clause: Punishment imposable on children | Text: A person who commits an act constituting an offence under the law shall not be liable to any punishment if that person has not attained ten years of age at the time of the commission of such act.

text: In imposing the punishment of imprisonment on a person who is ten years of age or above ten but below fourteen years of age, such person may be sentenced to imprisonment for a maximum of six months or sent to a reform home for a maximum of one year in lieu of such imprisonment.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
parent_text: Punishment imposable on children
chunk_text: Clause ID: 45(2) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief) | Parent Clause: Punishment imposable on children | Text: In imposing the punishment of imprisonment on a person who is ten years of age or above ten but below fourteen years of age, such person may be sentenced to imprisonment for a maximum of six months or sent to a reform home for a maximum of one year in lieu of such imprisonment.

text: Where a person who is fourteen years of age or above fourteen but below sixteen years of age commits any offence punishable by imprisonment, such person shall be liable to half the punishment imposable by law on a person who has attained majority.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
parent_text: Punishment imposable on children
chunk_text: Clause ID: 45(3) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief) | Parent Clause: Punishment imposable on children | Text: Where a person who is fourteen years of age or above fourteen but below sixteen years of age commits any offence punishable by imprisonment, such person shall be liable to half the punishment imposable by law on a person who has attained majority.

text: Where a person who is sixteen years of age or above sixteen but below eighteen years of age commits any offence punishable by imprisonment, such person shall be liable to two- thirds of the punishment imposable by law on a person who has attained majority.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
parent_text: Punishment imposable on children
chunk_text: Clause ID: 45(4) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief) | Parent Clause: Punishment imposable on children | Text: Where a person who is sixteen years of age or above sixteen but below eighteen years of age commits any offence punishable by imprisonment, such person shall be liable to two- thirds of the punishment imposable by law on a person who has attained majority.

text: Any offender who is unable to pay a fine imposed on him or her may be subjected to imprisonment. 27

parent_text: Imprisonment for fine

text: In determining the sentence of imprisonment in default of payment of a fine for an offence punishable by both imprisonment and fine, the term of imprisonment shall be so determined as not to exceed ten years.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
parent_text: The term of imprisonment under sub-section (1) shall be determined as follows:
chunk_text: Clause ID: 46(2)(a) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief) | Parent Clause: The term of imprisonment under sub-section (1) shall be determined as follows: | Text: In determining the sentence of imprisonment in default of payment of a fine for an offence punishable by both imprisonment and fine, the term of imprisonment shall be so determined as not to exceed ten years.

text: Where an offence is punishable by either imprisonment or fine or with both, in which the offender is sentenced to a fine only, in determining the sentence of imprisonment in default of payment of such fine, the term of imprisonment shall be so determined as not to exceed one half of the maximum term of imprisonment that can be imposed for such offence,
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
parent_text: The term of imprisonment under sub-section (1) shall be determined as follows:

text: Where an offence is punishable by fine only, in which the offender is sentenced to a fine, in determining the sentence of imprisonment in default of payment of such fine, the term of imprisonment shall be so determined as not to exceed two years.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
parent_text: The term of imprisonment under sub-section (1) shall be determined as follows:

text: Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (2), the following provisions shall apply to the imposition of a sentence of imprisonment for non-payment of a fine on a child below eighteen years of age: 28
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)

text: In the event of non-payment of a fine for an offence punishable by fine only or by either fine or imprisonment, the child shall not be subjected to imprisonment and the fine shall be remitted.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
parent_text: Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (2), the following provisions shall apply to the imposition of a sentence of imprisonment for non-payment of a fine on a child below eighteen years of age: 28

text: Where an offence is punishable by imprisonment or fine or both, in which the offender is sentenced to a fine only, in determining the sentence of imprisonment in default of payment of such fine, the term of imprisonment shall be so determined as not to exceed three months.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
parent_text: Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (2), the following provisions shall apply to the imposition of a sentence of imprisonment for non-payment of a fine on a child below eighteen years of age: 28

text: In determining the sentence of imprisonment pursuant to sub-section (2) to be imposed on a person who is above fourteen but below eighteen years of age, the term of imprisonment shall be so determined as not to exceed half the sentence of imprisonment imposable on a person above eighteen years of age.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)

text: Remission of sentence
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)

text: Where any offender, upon having confessed the offence committed by him or her, has assisted in the collection of evidence, apprehension of other accused person or gang or accomplice thereof, in relation to such offence or assisted the investigating or prosecuting authority or the court, a maximum of fifty percent of the sentence imposable under law for such offence may be remitted.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
parent_text: Remission of sentence

text: Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), the following offender shall not be entitled to the remission of sentence: 29

text: Power of court to order interim compensation
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
chunk_text: Clause ID: 48 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Power of court to order interim compensation

text: Notwithstanding anything contained elsewhere in this Act, where it is necessary to immediately provide medical treatment or compensation or any type of relief amount to a person who has become victim of an offence in consequence of its commission or a person who is dependent on him or her, the court may order the person accused of such offence to provide medical treatment or pay an interim compensation or relief amount to such person.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
parent_text: Power of court to order interim compensation

text: Where an order is made pursuant to sub-section (1), the person so accused shall immediately provide such compensation or amount to the victim or person dependent on him or her.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief)
parent_text: Power of court to order interim compensation
chunk_text: Clause ID: 48(2) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-1 (General Provisions) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief) | Parent Clause: Power of court to order interim compensation | Text: Where an order is made pursuant to sub-section (1), the person so accused shall immediately provide such compensation or amount to the victim or person dependent on him or her.

text: Where the accused is unable to provide the compensation or amount pursuant to sub-section (2) in accordance 30 with the order referred to in sub-section (1), the court shall order that the compensation or amount be provided to the victim or person dependent on him or her from the victim relief fund established pursuant to the laws in force related to the determination and execution of sentences for criminal offences, and the amount so provided shall be recovered from such accused person and reimbursed into such fund.

text: Where a person who has paid compensation or relief amount pursuant to this Section is acquitted of the charge by the judgment of the court, the person who has received such compensation or relief amount shall, within thirty-five days of such acquittal, return such amount to such person or to the victim relief fund referred to in sub-section (3).

text: Where such person does not return such amount within the period referred to in sub-section (4), the court shall cause such amount to be recovered from any assets of such person within thirty- five days of such acquittal. 31

text: Sedition
chunk_text: Clause ID: 50 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-1 (Offences against the State) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Sedition

text: No person shall, with the intention of overthrowing the Government of Nepal or the constitutional structure, create any kind of disorder by demonstrating or using military, paramilitary or criminal force or form an armed military or paramilitary organization or make conspiracy, attempt or incitement to commit such act.
parent_text: Sedition
chunk_text: Clause ID: 50(1) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-1 (Offences against the State) | Parent Clause: Sedition | Text: No person shall, with the intention of overthrowing the Government of Nepal or the constitutional structure, create any kind of disorder by demonstrating or using military, paramilitary or criminal force or form an armed military or paramilitary organization or make conspiracy, attempt or incitement to commit such act.

text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub- section (1) shall be liable to punishment with imprisonment for a term not exceeding twenty-five years.

text: No person shall, by words, either spoken or written or by figure or signs or otherwise, showing any baseless or unsubstantiated matter in relation to the Government of Nepal or any action of the Government of Nepal, bring or attempt to bring into hatred, enmity or contempt towards the Government of Nepal or cause the commission of such act. 33 Provided that nothing contained in this sub-section shall be considered to render any healthy or decent criticism of the Government of Nepal to be the offence.
parent_text: Sedition

text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub- section (3) shall be liable to the sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years or a fine not exceeding thirty thousand rupees.

text: Any Nepali player or a group of Nepali players, who representing Nepal, plays any match in competition with any player or players in Nepal or a foreign country shall not play, or cause to be 34 played, such match in connivance with or under the influence of any one in a manner to manipulate a natural result of such match or to make a bet win or lose, and where any match has been so played, the offence against national interest shall be considered to have been committed.

text: Prohibition of waging war against Nepal or assist the army of a State at war with Nepal: (1) No person shall wage or declare to wage war against Nepal, by raising arms, or attempt or threat to wage such war, or collect arms, ammunition or form a military or paramilitary organization with intent to wage war against Nepal.

text: Prohibition of espionage
chunk_text: Clause ID: 56 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-1 (Offences against the State) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of espionage

text: No person shall, with intent to undermine the sovereignty, security or geographical or territorial integrity of Nepal or to prejudice the interests of Nepal or with the knowledge that such consequence is likely, or being induced by any foreign country or international organization, supply to any one any information relating to the military situation, strategic arrangement or internal security of Nepal or relating to any matter that must be kept confidential by the Government of Nepal from the political, economic or diplomatic viewpoint or confidential document, or any matter that is confidential or must be kept confidential under law or conspire or attempt to commit, or abet the commission of, such act or do any other act with intent to supply such information, and a person who commits such act shall be considered to have committed espionage.

text: Prohibition of intimidation of President or Parliament
chunk_text: Clause ID: 58 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-1 (Offences against the State) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of intimidation of President or Parliament

text: No person shall intimidate, whether by using any kind of force or not, show fear or terror to, or otherwise overawe the President or Parliament of Nepal with intent to prevent or restrain the President or Parliament of Nepal from performing any of the functions required to be performed pursuant to the Constitution or law or compel the President or Parliament of Nepal to perform the functions in any specific manner.

text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding seven years or a fine not exceeding seventy thousand rupees or with both. Explanation: For the purposes of this Section, the term "Parliament" means the Federal Parliament and the State Assembly under the Constitution of Nepal, and this term also includes the Legislature-Parliament.

text: Any person who, with the knowledge that it is an unlawful assembly, joins the assembly shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months and a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees where he or she has joined it without arms, and imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year and a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees where he or she has joined it with arms.
parent_text: Prohibition of unlawful assembly
chunk_text: Clause ID: 60(3) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of unlawful assembly | Text: Any person who, with the knowledge that it is an unlawful assembly, joins the assembly shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months and a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees where he or she has joined it without arms, and imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year and a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees where he or she has joined it with arms.

text: Any person who himself or herself does not join an unlawful assembly but hires or otherwise induces or overawes another to join such assembly shall be liable to the sentence referred to in sub-section (3) as if he or she himself or herself had joined such unlawful assembly.
parent_text: Prohibition of unlawful assembly

text: Prohibition of breach of order issued to prevent or disperse unlawful assembly: (1) Where a competent authority makes an order to prevent or disperse an unlawful assembly, no person shall participate or continue in such assembly.
chunk_text: Clause ID: 61 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of breach of order issued to prevent or disperse unlawful assembly: (1) Where a competent authority makes an order to prevent or disperse an unlawful assembly, no person shall participate or continue in such assembly.

text: A person who continues in, participates in, or joins an unlawful assembly under sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees or with both.

text: Every member to be considered to have committed offence: Where any member of an unlawful assembly commits any offence in the achievement of the object of such assembly, every member of such assembly who aids and assists knowingly at the time of the commission of offence shall be considered to have committed the offence. 45
chunk_text: Clause ID: 62 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Every member to be considered to have committed offence: Where any member of an unlawful assembly commits any offence in the achievement of the object of such assembly, every member of such assembly who aids and assists knowingly at the time of the commission of offence shall be considered to have committed the offence. 45

text: Prohibition of rioting
chunk_text: Clause ID: 63 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of rioting

text: No person shall commit, or cause to be committed, the offence of rioting.
parent_text: Prohibition of rioting
chunk_text: Clause ID: 63(1) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of rioting | Text: No person shall commit, or cause to be committed, the offence of rioting.

text: Where an unlawful assembly or a member thereof uses force or destroys, damages or causes loss to any public or private property in the course of achievement of the object of such assembly, every member of such assembly shall be considered to have committed the offence of rioting.
parent_text: Prohibition of rioting
chunk_text: Clause ID: 63(2) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of rioting | Text: Where an unlawful assembly or a member thereof uses force or destroys, damages or causes loss to any public or private property in the course of achievement of the object of such assembly, every member of such assembly shall be considered to have committed the offence of rioting.

text: Every person who commits the offense referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years and a fine not exceeding twenty thousand rupees if he or she is armed with a deadly weapon, and to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year and a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees if he or she is not armed with a deadly weapon.
parent_text: Prohibition of rioting
chunk_text: Clause ID: 63(3) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of rioting | Text: Every person who commits the offense referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years and a fine not exceeding twenty thousand rupees if he or she is armed with a deadly weapon, and to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year and a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees if he or she is not armed with a deadly weapon.

text: Prohibition of abetting rioting
chunk_text: Clause ID: 64 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of abetting rioting

text: No person shall, with intent to cause the commission of rioting or with the knowledge that rioting is likely to be committed, abet the commission of rioting by another person.
parent_text: Prohibition of abetting rioting
chunk_text: Clause ID: 64(1) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of abetting rioting | Text: No person shall, with intent to cause the commission of rioting or with the knowledge that rioting is likely to be committed, abet the commission of rioting by another person.

text: A person who abets under sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year, if the offence of rioting is committed, and to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months, if the offence of rioting is not committed, or to a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or the both sentences.
parent_text: Prohibition of abetting rioting
chunk_text: Clause ID: 64(2) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of abetting rioting | Text: A person who abets under sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year, if the offence of rioting is committed, and to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months, if the offence of rioting is not committed, or to a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or the both sentences.

text: Prohibition of acts prejudicial to public tranquility
chunk_text: Clause ID: 65 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of acts prejudicial to public tranquility

text: No person, by words, either spoken or written or by signs or otherwise 46 shall do any act which, on the ground of religion, color, caste, race, community or language, is prejudicial to harmonious relationship between peoples of different classes, regions or communities of Nepal.
parent_text: Prohibition of acts prejudicial to public tranquility
chunk_text: Clause ID: 65(1) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of acts prejudicial to public tranquility | Text: No person, by words, either spoken or written or by signs or otherwise 46 shall do any act which, on the ground of religion, color, caste, race, community or language, is prejudicial to harmonious relationship between peoples of different classes, regions or communities of Nepal.

text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year and a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees.
parent_text: Prohibition of acts prejudicial to public tranquility
chunk_text: Clause ID: 65(2) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of acts prejudicial to public tranquility | Text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year and a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees.

text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub- section (1) in any shrine, deity place, place of worship or pray or in any assembly engaged in the performance of a religious or cultural festival or ceremony shall be liable to an additional sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year, in addition to the sentence referred to in sub-section (2).
parent_text: Prohibition of acts prejudicial to public tranquility

text: Prohibition of obstructing public servant
chunk_text: Clause ID: 66 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of obstructing public servant

text: No person shall obstruct or attempt to obstruct any public official in the discharge of his or her duty in endeavoring to prevent or disperse an unlawful assembly or to suppress a riot.
parent_text: Prohibition of obstructing public servant

text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees or both sentences.

text: Prohibition of obstructing movement in public place
chunk_text: Clause ID: 67 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of obstructing movement in public place

text: No person, by show of any kind of fear or terror, shall close the operation of a public road, way, rope-way, cable-car, airport, railway, water transportation route, postal and other public service, 47 or obstruct, in any way, the movement of pedestrians, motor vehicles or animals by obstructing, in any way, a public road, way, rope-way, cable-car way, airport, railway or water transportation route or impede or obstruct, in any way, any person in entering into any public place except in accordance with the order of a competent authority under a law.
parent_text: Prohibition of obstructing movement in public place
chunk_text: Clause ID: 67(1) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of obstructing movement in public place | Text: No person, by show of any kind of fear or terror, shall close the operation of a public road, way, rope-way, cable-car, airport, railway, water transportation route, postal and other public service, 47 or obstruct, in any way, the movement of pedestrians, motor vehicles or animals by obstructing, in any way, a public road, way, rope-way, cable-car way, airport, railway or water transportation route or impede or obstruct, in any way, any person in entering into any public place except in accordance with the order of a competent authority under a law.

text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence under sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years or a fine not exceeding thirty thousand rupees or both the sentences.

text: Not to spread rumor
chunk_text: Clause ID: 70 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Not to spread rumor

text: No person shall, with intent to breach public tranquility, commit rioting or undermine or jeopardize the sovereignty, geographical or territorial integrity of Nepal or harmonious relation between different races, castes or communities, spread or propagate rumors or hold a procession with slogans, in a manner to provoke any one.

text: Prohibition of providing house, land or vehicle for breaching peace: No person, knowingly or having a reasonable reason to know that another person is going to breach public peace or commit rioting, shall provide his or her house, land, vehicle or arm to that other person.

text: Prohibition of holding tourch procession in sensitive public area:
chunk_text: Clause ID: 72 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of holding tourch procession in sensitive public area:

text: No person shall, with intent to breach public peace, hold any tourch procession or assembly or procession carrying a fire or inflammable substance in any place specified as the sensitive public area by order of the competent authority in view of the sovereignty, geographical or territorial integrity, security of Nepal or pubic tranquility or decency. 49

text: Prohibition of destroying or damaging essential commodities
chunk_text: Clause ID: 73 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of destroying or damaging essential commodities

text: No person shall, having committed any offence under this Chapter, destroy, damage or set on fire, or cause to be done so, any commodity which is regarded as an essential commodity under the law or public or private property or disorder such commodity or property by himself or herself or cause it to be disordered by another person, steal such commodity or property or knowingly buy or sell, or cause to be bought or sold, any commodity obtained by theft.
parent_text: Prohibition of destroying or damaging essential commodities
chunk_text: Clause ID: 73(1) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of destroying or damaging essential commodities | Text: No person shall, having committed any offence under this Chapter, destroy, damage or set on fire, or cause to be done so, any commodity which is regarded as an essential commodity under the law or public or private property or disorder such commodity or property by himself or herself or cause it to be disordered by another person, steal such commodity or property or knowingly buy or sell, or cause to be bought or sold, any commodity obtained by theft.

text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub- section (1) shall be liable to an additional sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees or both the sentences, in addition to the sentence imposable for any offence referred to in this Chapter.
parent_text: Prohibition of destroying or damaging essential commodities
chunk_text: Clause ID: 73(2) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-2 (Offences against Public Tranquility) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of destroying or damaging essential commodities | Text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub- section (1) shall be liable to an additional sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees or both the sentences, in addition to the sentence imposable for any offence referred to in this Chapter.

text: Where such commodity or property has already been destroyed or damaged from the offence referred to in sub-section (1), a compensation equal to the claimed amount shall also be recovered from such person.

chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants)

text: Prohibition of refusing to receive and returning summons, process, notice or order: (1) Where a person in whose name a summons, process, notice, arrest warrant or order has been issued under law is tendered for the service thereof on him or her, such person shall, with mala fide intention, not refuse to receive, and return, such summons, process, notice or arrest warrant.

text: Prohibition of absconding to avoid service of summons, process, notice or order: (1) No person, being legally bound to receive a summons, process, notice, arrest warrant or order issued by the competent authority, shall abscond, with mala fide intention to avoid being served with such summons, process, notice, arrest warrant or order.

text: No person who is legally bound to produce or deliver up any document to any office, court or public servant under law shall omit so to produce or deliver up such document.

text: Prohibition of making false statement by person under oath
chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants)
chunk_text: Clause ID: 81 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of making false statement by person under oath

text: A person who is bound by law or by an oath to state the truth on any subject to any competent authority or is a public office holder upon taking oath under law shall not, in that capacity, state any false statement.

text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub- section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years or a fine not exceeding twenty thousand rupees or both the sentences.

text: Prohibition of refusing to answer
chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants)
chunk_text: Clause ID: 83 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of refusing to answer

text: No person who is under a legal duty to state the truth on any subject to a competent authority shall refuse to answer any question demanded of him or her on such subject by such authority. Provided that no person shall be compelled to testify against himself or herself.

text: Prohibition of giving false information

text: No person shall give any false information to any one, with intent to prevent any public servant from doing any act which he or she is bound by law to do or to cause such public servant to do anything which he or she need not or ought not to do.

text: No person shall, by way of intimidation or force or in any other way, obstruct or hinder any public servant, who is discharging his or her public duties, in the discharge of such duties.

text: Prohibition of fabricating evidence
chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants)
chunk_text: Clause ID: 89 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of fabricating evidence

text: Except as otherwise provided in this Act, no person shall fabricate evidence, cause any circumstance to exist, forge any document or electronic record or make any false entry in any document or electronic record, with intent to use it in a judicial or other legal proceeding.
chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants)
parent_text: Prohibition of fabricating evidence
chunk_text: Clause ID: 89(1) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of fabricating evidence | Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Act, no person shall fabricate evidence, cause any circumstance to exist, forge any document or electronic record or make any false entry in any document or electronic record, with intent to use it in a judicial or other legal proceeding.

text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years and a fine not exceeding fifty thousand rupees. Provided that where a sentence of imprisonment for life has been imposed on any person on the basis of such false evidence, the offender shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding seven years and a fine not exceeding seventy thousand rupees.
chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants)
parent_text: Prohibition of fabricating evidence
chunk_text: Clause ID: 89(2) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of fabricating evidence | Text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years and a fine not exceeding fifty thousand rupees. Provided that where a sentence of imprisonment for life has been imposed on any person on the basis of such false evidence, the offender shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding seven years and a fine not exceeding seventy thousand rupees.

text: Notwithstanding anything contained elsewhere in this Section, no sentence shall be so imposed under this Section that the sentence is in excess of the maximum sentence that can be imposed on the offence in relation to which the evidence has been fabricated.
chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants)
parent_text: Prohibition of fabricating evidence
chunk_text: Clause ID: 89(3) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of fabricating evidence | Text: Notwithstanding anything contained elsewhere in this Section, no sentence shall be so imposed under this Section that the sentence is in excess of the maximum sentence that can be imposed on the offence in relation to which the evidence has been fabricated.

text: No person with authority or duty under law to submit, certify, authenticate or issue a certificate or submit an affidavit in relation to any matter shall submit, certify, authenticate or issue such certificate or submit such affidavit, knowingly setting down a false statement in such certificate or affidavit. 57

chunk_text: Clause ID: 92 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of destroying document

text: No person who is under a legal duty to produce any document or electronic record as evidence in a judicial or other legal proceeding shall knowingly destroy, obliterate, render illegible such document or record, or otherwise make it incapable of being used as evidence.

text: Prohibition of harboring offender
chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants)
chunk_text: Clause ID: 95 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of harboring offender

text: No person shall knowingly harbor an offender with intent to prevent him or her from being apprehended or save him or her from a lawful sentence. Explanation: For the purposes of this Section, the term “offender” means a person who is suspected or accused of an offence or convicted by a court of such offence.

text: Obligation to give information of commission of offence
chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants)

text: No person under a legal duty to give information regarding any offence shall, knowing that such offence has been or is going to be committed, omit to give information of such offence or no person who knows the commission of any offence shall intentionally give false information about that offence.

text: Prohibition of concealment of property or fraudulent claim to property: (1) No person shall fraudulently conceal, transfer or deliver to any person, or caused to be concealed, transferred or delivered, any property, or right in such property, which is liable to be forfeited, withheld, auctioned, sold or enforced or inventory of which is to be taken pursuant to a decision of a court or competent authority, intending thereby to prevent that property or right from being so forfeited, withheld, auctioned, sold or enforced or make a claim to such property or right therein.

text: Prohibition of making false complaint

chunk_text: Clause ID: 98 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of making false complaint

text: No person shall, with intent to injure or annoy any person, make a false claim or accusation or give false information against such person before or to an authority making judicial proceeding.
chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants)
parent_text: Prohibition of making false complaint
chunk_text: Clause ID: 98(1) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-3 (Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of making false complaint | Text: No person shall, with intent to injure or annoy any person, make a false claim or accusation or give false information against such person before or to an authority making judicial proceeding.

text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable half the maximum sentence imposable for the offence in respect of which such false accusation has been made. Provided that the provision of this Section shall not apply to any case in which the Government of Nepal is plaintiff.

text: Where the offence referred to in sub-section (1) has resulted in any kind of harm or loss to a person who is a victim of such offence, compensation for such harm or loss shall be recovered from the offender to the victim.

text: No authority responsible by law for making investigation or prosecution shall make investigation or prosecution maliciously, with intent to have an innocent person bear liability or to save the real offender.

text: Prohibition of failure to appear in violation of terms and conditions of guarantee: (1) No person who has been charged with an offence and released on guarantee shall fail, without a reasonable cause, to appear in the office or court to which guarantee is given in accordance with the terms and conditions of such guarantee. Explanation: For the purpose of this Section, “guarantee” means cash, bank guarantee or personal guarantee.

Explanation: For the purpose of this Section, “guarantee” means cash, bank guarantee or personal guarantee.

text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub- section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees or both the sentences.

parent_text: Prohibition of failure to appear in violation of terms and conditions of guarantee: (1) No person who has been charged with an offence and released on guarantee shall fail, without a reasonable cause, to appear in the office or court to which guarantee is given in accordance with the terms and conditions of such guarantee. Explanation: For the purpose of this Section, “guarantee” means cash, bank guarantee or personal guarantee.

text: Prohibition of spreading infectious disease
chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,)
chunk_text: Clause ID: 104 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of spreading infectious disease

text: No person shall do any act that spreads or is likely to spread any kind of infectious disease which is dangerous to life of any one.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,)
parent_text: Prohibition of spreading infectious disease
chunk_text: Clause ID: 104(1) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of spreading infectious disease | Text: No person shall do any act that spreads or is likely to spread any kind of infectious disease which is dangerous to life of any one.

text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years and a fine not exceeding one hundred thousand rupees, if the offence has been committed intentionally or knowingly, to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years and a fine not exceeding fifty thousand rupees, if the offence has been committed recklessly, and to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years and a fine not exceeding thirty thousand rupees, if the offence has been committed negligently.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,)
parent_text: Prohibition of spreading infectious disease
chunk_text: Clause ID: 104(2) | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,) | Parent Clause: Prohibition of spreading infectious disease | Text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years and a fine not exceeding one hundred thousand rupees, if the offence has been committed intentionally or knowingly, to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years and a fine not exceeding fifty thousand rupees, if the offence has been committed recklessly, and to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years and a fine not exceeding thirty thousand rupees, if the offence has been committed negligently.

text: Prohibition of transmitting human immuno-deficiency virus (HIV positive): (1) No person, knowing that his or her own body or any other's body contains human immuno-deficiency virus (HIV positive) or the virus of Hepatitis B, shall with intent to transmit such disease to another person, donate his or her blood to such person or cause the donation of such other person's blood or have sexual intercourse with any one without taking any kind of precaution or transfuse in any way his or her or such person's blood, semen, saliva, sputum or human organ into other's body. 66
chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,)
chunk_text: Clause ID: 105 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of transmitting human immuno-deficiency virus (HIV positive): (1) No person, knowing that his or her own body or any other's body contains human immuno-deficiency virus (HIV positive) or the virus of Hepatitis B, shall with intent to transmit such disease to another person, donate his or her blood to such person or cause the donation of such other person's blood or have sexual intercourse with any one without taking any kind of precaution or transfuse in any way his or her or such person's blood, semen, saliva, sputum or human organ into other's body. 66

text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years and a fine not exceeding one hundred thousand rupees. Provided that where such disease has got transmitted with negligence or recklessness, failing any intent to transmit it, the offender shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years and a fine not exceeding thirty thousand rupees.

text: Prohibition of violating law relating to communicable disease
chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,)
chunk_text: Clause ID: 106 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of violating law relating to communicable disease

text: No person shall violate any rule, directive or order relating to communicable diseases issued by the Government of Nepal, State Government or Local Level or the competent authority under law.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,)
parent_text: Prohibition of violating law relating to communicable disease

text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months or a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or both the sentences. Provided that where any violation of such rule, directive or order is likely to cause the death of a person, the offender shall be liable to the sentence under Section 104. 67

text: Prohibition of adulteration of food
chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,)
chunk_text: Clause ID: 107 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of adulteration of food

text: No person shall produce any food or drink to be consumed by the public by mixing into it any injurious substance that is inedible, undrinkable or inconsumable or any substance that is edible, drinkable or consumable but substandard or any injurious chemical substance, or sell or distribute it or sell or distribute any food of which expiry date has expired or which is adulterated or sell, distribute, import or offer for sale or distribution any food of standard falling short of the prescribed standard or inedible substance.
chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,)
parent_text: Prohibition of adulteration of food

text: Any person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years and a fine not exceeding fifty thousand rupees.

text: Prohibition of hoarding consumable goods intended for sale
chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,)
chunk_text: Clause ID: 110 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of hoarding consumable goods intended for sale

text: No person shall increase the price of any consumable goods by creating an artificial shortage of such goods in the market or sell, or cause to be sold, such goods at higher price or dump, store or hoard such goods by refraining from selling such goods with the motive of making undue profit from the sale of such goods.

text: Prohibition of soliciting alms (begging) or causing begging

chunk_text: Clause ID: 126 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-5 (Offences against Public Interest, Health, Safety,) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of soliciting alms (begging) or causing begging

text: No person shall solicit alms (begging) in a public place or use a child 77 for the purposes of begging under the pretense of singing, dancing, playing or doing any act or use other person for purposes of begging, in return for any kind of money or wages paid by him or her to that other person, or abet begging.

text: In the case of any offence under this Chapter which has caused the death of any one, there shall be no statute of limitation for making a complaint in relation to such offence.

text: No person shall transact arms and ammunition without obtaining a license or in a manner to be contrary to the terms and restrictions specified in the license, even if, obtained. chunk_text: Clause ID: 132 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-6 (Offences Relating to Arms and Ammunitions) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of retaining or carrying arms without license

text: No person shall acquire, retain, stockpile, use or carry such arms as may be allowed by law to be acquired, held, stockpiled, used or carried, without obtaining a license or in a manner to be contrary to the terms and restrictions specified in the license, even if, obtained. Provided that nothing shall bar any officer and personnel of the Nepal Army, Nepal Police, Armed Police Force, Nepal concerned with security work or other security personnel who are entitled to use arms lawfully from holding, using or carrying such arms in the course of discharging their respective duties.

text: Forfeiture of movable, immovable property related to offence: In the event of the commission of any offence under this Chapter, the arms and ammunition related to such offence, and machinery, equipment, instrument or vehicle producing, manufacturing, retaining or transporting such arms and proceeds of the sale and purchase of such arms or ammunition and amount accrued or accumulated therefrom shall be forfeited. Provided that where the owner of the means of transport or motor vehicle proves that he or she did not know the transportation of such arms and ammunition, such means of transport or vehicle shall not be forfeited.

Provided that where the owner of the means of transport or motor vehicle proves that he or she did not know the transportation of such arms and ammunition, such means of transport or vehicle shall not be forfeited.

text: Compensation caused to be paid: Where any harm or loss is caused to any one's body or property from the commission by any person of any offence under this Chapter, a reasonable compensation for such harm or loss shall be caused to be paid by the offender to the victim.

text: Prohibition of transaction of explosives
chunk_text: Clause ID: 139 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-7 (Offences Relating to Explosives) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of transaction of explosives

text: No person shall transact explosives without obtaining a license or in a manner to be contrary to the terms and restrictions specified in the license, even if, obtained. Explanation: For the purposes of this Chapter, the term "transaction" means procurement, sale, retention, use, stockpiling, storage, transport, alteration, mixing, export or import.

text: Prohibition of making land mines or laying explosives
chunk_text: Clause ID: 141 | Legal Source: National Criminal Code, 2017 AD | Part: Part-2 (Criminal Offences) | Chapter: Chapter-7 (Offences Relating to Explosives) | Parent Clause: None | Text: Prohibition of making land mines or laying explosives

text: No person shall lay or place any explosive, any inflammable substance or making an electronic ambush in a public road or way, place, building, bridge, tunnel or any other place for the public movement or cause obstruction to the movement or use of any other public utilities by placing such substance or making an ambush.

text: Obligation to take care while importing, transporting or stockpiling explosives: (1) A person who licensed to carry out the transaction of explosives shall, in using, carrying, transporting or stockpiling such explosives, so use such explosives as to ensure adequate safety according to the nature of such explosives or carry, transport or stockpile such explosives, having kept them in appropriate magazines. 90
